properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 17 at 12:25PM CST until January 17 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Kansas City/Pleasant HIll MO
properties.description:
...Winter Storm Expected Friday...

.Ongoing freezing rain will continue to make for hazardous
conditions through the early to perhaps mid-afternoon hours.
Temperatures for areas south of I-70 should warm to above freezing
this afternoon, which will transition freezing rain to liquid
rain. An early cancellation to the Winter Storm Warning and
southern extent of the Winter Weather Advisory is likely if
current warming trends hold this afternoon.

* WHAT...Significant icing. Additional ice accumulations of a
light glaze. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph.

* WHERE...In Kansas, Linn KS and Miami Counties. In Missouri,
Bates and Cass Counties.

* WHEN...Until 6 PM CST this evening.

* IMPACTS...Very slippery sidewalks, roads and bridges are
possible. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening
commute.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency. Prepare for possible power
outages.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING
